description.narrative: Funding of this project aims to develop the institutional capacity of the Royal Institute of Management (RIM) in the delivery of 3 in-country masters programs: Masters in Public Administration (MPA); Masters in Management (MM); and Masters in Business Administration (MBA), with the overall goal of upgrading the professional capacity of the managerial/administrative manpower in Bhutan. The 3 masters programs delivered produce on average 30 masters degree holders in each program. The program also aims to carry out research in collaboration with Twinning partners. The funding will support this by building the capacity and expertise of RIM faculty members through mentoring programs in partner institutions. At least 18-20 faculty will be specialised and 35-40 faculty members will be trained in research methodology and training of trainers skills, enabling RIM to sustain the delivery of masters programs.
